meanings.definition: In a weak or feeble manner
meanings.sent1: She walked pulingly, unable to keep up with the others.
meanings.sent2: He spoke pulingly, his voice barely audible in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The kitten meowed pulingly, asking for more treats.
meanings.sent4: The old car moved pulingly, struggling to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled pulingly through the cracks in the window.

meanings.definition: Whining or complaining in a weak manner
meanings.sent1: The pulingly child refused to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent2: She gave me a pulingly look when I asked her to help.
meanings.sent3: The pulingly customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent4: His pulingly tone irritated everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The pulingly dog barked at every passing car.
